Officers dispatched to a report of an unwanted guest urinating on the sidewalk adjacent to the building. Officers arrived, located the individual, and reported that they were in the process of removing several of their belongings placed against  the building under a "No Trespass" sign. Officers then approached the individual and conducted a field interview. During   the field interview, the individual engaged in uncooperative behavior and repeatedly refused to provide the officers with  accurate identifying information. At this time, the individual made several statements pertaining to their involvement in  urinating on the sidewalk in front of pedestrians. Once the individual's true identity was determined, they were run for   wants/warrants with negative results. The individual was then informed that they were being placed under arrest for        Indecent Exposure and Trespassing. The individual was then transported to the Harvard University Police Department for     booking and issued a verbal trespass warning for all Harvard University property.                                                                                                                                                                     Name: Stearns, Elizabeth                                                                                                   Age: 53                                                                                                                    Address: Homeless                                                                                                          Charge(s): Indecent Exposure                                                                                               Trespassing

description: Officers dispatched to a report of an individual harassing pedestrians and kicking over property in the area. Officers     arrived and reported that Cambridge Police was on scene and speaking with an individual matching the description of the    person engaged in the harassing and disruptive behavior. Officers then approached Cambridge Police who reported that a     victim was in the immediate area seeking medical attention due to an assault committed by the aforementioned individual.   While at the scene, officers reported that the individual began to engage in increasingly erratic behavior and was         subsequently placed in handcuffs by Cambridge Police. Cambridge Police then reported that a witness to the incident        previously observed the individual in custody throw a glass bottle at the victim's backpack which subsequently broke apart upon impact with the ground. According to the witness, the individual then retrieved a shard of glass from the broken      bottle and lunged towards the victim. Shortly thereafter, the victim arrived to the scene and identified the individual in custody as the person who assaulted them with the glass bottle. The individual was then informed that they were being      placed under arrest and transported to the Harvard University Police Department for booking. While at the Department, the  individual was issued a verbal trespass warning for all Harvard University Property. Officers then performed an inventory  search of the individual's property and discovered several items of drug paraphernalia and a plastic bag containing a      white and clear crystal substance resembling Methamphetamine. Pro Ambulance was then requested and arrived on scene and    the individual was transported to a medical facility for further evaluation.                                                                                                                                                                          Name: Haugh, Francis                                                                                                       Age: 40                                                                                                                    Address: Homeless                                                                                                          Charge(s): Assault and Battery with a Dangerous Weapon (2 Counts)

description:
Officers dispatched to a report of a fire alarm and power outage in the building. Officers arrived and reported that      
Cambridge Fire was on scene and that several smoke detectors had been activated in the basement. Upon further             
investigation, officers reported smoke and a burning odor emitting from the basement. Officers and Cambridge Fire then    
discovered a small electrical fire and reported that the building was subsequently evacuated. Following the evacuation and
upon consultation with Cambridge Fire, it was determined that the fire was likely caused by the power outage. At the      
conclusion of the incident, officers reported that the fire was ultimately extinguished on its own and that occupants     
re-entered the building once it was deemed safe.

Officers dispatched to a report of a disturbance and possible assault in the area. Officers arrived and reported that      Cambridge Police was on scene and had detained an individual actively screaming and resisting arrest. Officers approached  Cambridge Police and reported that CPD had been responding to a possible assault in progress, when the individual was      observed attempting to flee the immediate area and subsequently detained. While on scene, officers were then approached by three juveniles who wished to report a recent assault committed by the individual. According to the three juveniles, the individual had been observed accosting pedestrians while waving a wooden stake in the air inside of Harvard Yard. When the
three juveniles approached the individual regarding their behavior, the individual grabbed one of the juveniles by their  
head and a physical altercation ensued between all parties. According to the three juveniles, during the altercation, the 
individual repeatedly attempted to strike them with the aforementioned wooden stake. One of the juveniles then attempted  
to contact the police when the individual brandished a folded knife, waved it in the air, and stated "I got a knife".     
Shortly thereafter, Cambridge Police arrived on scene and the individual was apprehended after they attempted to flee the 
area. At the conclusion of the incident, the individual was placed under arrest and transported to the Cambridge Police   
Department for booking.

Officers dispatched to a report of a disturbance and possible assault in the area. Officers arrived and reported that      Cambridge Police was on scene and had detained an individual actively screaming and resisting arrest. Officers approached  Cambridge Police and reported that CPD had been responding to a possible assault in progress, when the individual was      observed attempting to flee the immediate area and subsequently detained. While on scene, officers were then approached by three juveniles who wished to report a recent assault committed by the individual. According to the three juveniles, the individual had been observed accosting pedestrians while waving a wooden stake in the air inside of Harvard Yard. When the
three juveniles approached the individual regarding their behavior, the individual grabbed one of the juveniles by their  
head and a physical altercation ensued between all parties. According to the three juveniles, during the altercation, the 
individual repeatedly attempted to strike them with the aforementioned wooden stake. One of the juveniles then attempted  
to contact the police when the individual brandished a folded knife, waved it in the air, and stated "I got a knife".     
Shortly thereafter, Cambridge Police arrived on scene and the individual was apprehended after they attempted to flee the 
area. At the conclusion of the incident, the individual was placed under arrest and transported to the Cambridge Police   
Department for booking.

Officers arrived, located the individual, and reported that they were in the process of removing several of their belongings placed against  the building under a "No Trespass" sign. At this time, the individual made several statements pertaining to their involvement in  urinating on the sidewalk in front of pedestrians. Once the individual's true identity was determined, they were run for   wants/warrants with negative results. The individual was then informed that they were being placed under arrest for        Indecent Exposure and Trespassing. description:
Officers dispatched to a report of an individual harassing pedestrians and kicking over property in the area. Officers    
arrived and reported that Cambridge Police was on scene and speaking with an individual matching the description of the   
person engaged in the harassing and disruptive behavior. Officers then approached Cambridge Police who reported that a    
victim was in the immediate area seeking medical attention due to an assault committed by the aforementioned individual.  
While at the scene, officers reported that the individual began to engage in increasingly erratic behavior and was        
subsequently placed in handcuffs by Cambridge Police. Cambridge Police then reported that a witness to the incident       
previously observed the individual in custody throw a glass bottle at the victim's backpack which subsequently broke apart
upon impact with the ground. According to the witness, the individual then retrieved a shard of glass from the broken     
bottle and lunged towards the victim. Shortly thereafter, the victim arrived to the scene and identified the individual in
custody as the person who assaulted them with the glass bottle. The individual was then informed that they were being     
placed under arrest and transported to the Harvard University Police Department for booking. While at the Department, the 
individual was issued a verbal trespass warning for all Harvard University Property. Officers then performed an inventory 
search of the individual's property and discovered several items of drug paraphernalia and a plastic bag containing a     
white and clear crystal substance resembling Methamphetamine. Pro Ambulance was then requested and arrived on scene and   
the individual was transported to a medical facility for further evaluation.                                              
                                                                                                                          
Name: Haugh, Francis                                                                                                      
Age: 40                                                                                                                   
Address: Homeless                                                                                                         
Charge(s): Assault and Battery with a Dangerous Weapon (2 Counts)

The property was then returned to the owner and the individuals were sent on   their way.

Officers while on detail observed a demonstration at an event in the building. Officers reported that several individuals  were silently holding signs and, after a few minutes, the individuals left the building. Shortly thereafter, officers      reported two individuals loudly yelling and causing a disturbance. Officers reported that the individuals were requested   to cease their shouting by the moderator, however, continued to yell and interrupt the event. Upon the request of the      moderator, the two individuals were then escorted outside of the event by officers and it was reported that the event      proceeded without further incident.

description: Officers dispatched to a report of an individual harassing pedestrians and kicking over property in the area. Officers     arrived and reported that Cambridge Police was on scene and speaking with an individual matching the description of the    person engaged in the harassing and disruptive behavior. Officers then approached Cambridge Police who reported that a     victim was in the immediate area seeking medical attention due to an assault committed by the aforementioned individual.   While at the scene, officers reported that the individual began to engage in increasingly erratic behavior and was         subsequently placed in handcuffs by Cambridge Police. Cambridge Police then reported that a witness to the incident        previously observed the individual in custody throw a glass bottle at the victim's backpack which subsequently broke apart upon impact with the ground. According to the witness, the individual then retrieved a shard of glass from the broken      bottle and lunged towards the victim. Shortly thereafter, the victim arrived to the scene and identified the individual in custody as the person who assaulted them with the glass bottle. The individual was then informed that they were being      placed under arrest and transported to the Harvard University Police Department for booking. While at the Department, the  individual was issued a verbal trespass warning for all Harvard University Property. Officers then performed an inventory  search of the individual's property and discovered several items of drug paraphernalia and a plastic bag containing a      white and clear crystal substance resembling Methamphetamine. Pro Ambulance was then requested and arrived on scene and    the individual was transported to a medical facility for further evaluation.                                                                                                                                                                          Name: Haugh, Francis                                                                                                       Age: 40                                                                                                                    Address: Homeless                                                                                                          Charge(s): Assault and Battery with a Dangerous Weapon (2 Counts)

Officer while on detail received a report of an individual in need of assistance. Officer arrived and located the          reporting person who stated that an event staff member had been assaulted. According to the reporting person, prior to     officers arrival, a patron had proceeded through a security checkpoint without authorization and refused numerous requests to submit their belongings for a bag check. According to the reporting person, when the staff member attempted to stop the patron, the patron shoved the staff member. Shortly thereafter, officers reported that the offender was located inside a   locker room in a nearby building. Officers reported that the offender continued to engage in uncooperative behavior as     well as committed an assault against an officer. Officer reported that the offender eventually became more co-operative    and a field interview was subsequently conducted. Following the field interview, the offender was issued a verbal trespass warning for all Harvard University property and escorted out of the building.
address: ATHLETICS - STADIUM 79 N HARVARD ST ALLSTON

Officers dispatched to a report of an individual possibly attempting to steal a bicycle from the bike rack near the        building. Officers arrived, located the individual, and conducted a field interview. During the field interview, the       individual stated that the aforementioned bicycle belonged to them and provided a combination to the lock affixed to the   bicycle. Officers then located the reporting party who stated that they had previously observed the individual attempting  to remove the bicycle from the rack. At this time, officers then located the bicycle and attempted to use the combination  provided by the individual with negative results. The individual was then run for wants/warrants with positive results for an active warrant. At this time, the individual was informed that they were being placed under arrest for Warrant Services and Attempt to Commit a Larceny of a Bicycle. The individual was then transported to the Cambridge Police Department for   holding.
